column4: make sure libapache2-mod-php5 installed, and php5.conf and php5.load is enabled
libapache2-mod-php5 is already installed according to apt-get
check mods-enable and make sure they are there
you need to manually link them if they are not there
yes
if you take a look the apache2.conf file you will see the Include directives
I see it.
once you've done, reload the config and you should good to go
hmm.. that's weird
What should I check next?
you linked php5.conf and php5.load both?
check the log then
Where is the log?
cause that's all you need to do. there might have something else missing
/var/log/apache2
No other errors than not being able to figure the server name.
you can try tail -f the access.log and error.log and then click the php file and see if there is anything generated
It just started to parse it...  Without even a restart since I last restarted it.  Weird...
huh ok.. :)
No wait, it parses infophp.php but won't load phpmyadmin (it offers to download it).
that's probably some different stories
as long as apache parses php files, the func should be setup correctly.
ok
